titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Merrill K. Bennett Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Unpublished papers and speeches (1923-1966) on topics such as agricultural costs, wartime economy, food problems of post-war Europe, and world population problems; correspondence; newsclippings; pamphlets; mementos; and other papers relating to Bennett's travels to Hawaii (1942), Japan (1947), and Africa.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Merrill K. Bennett papers (SC0149). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Director, Stanford Food Research Institute (1952-1962); executive director (1942-1951); faculty member (1922-1962). Bennett was an authority on the economics of food consumption.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Unpublished papers and speeches (1923-1966) on topics such as agricultural costs, wartime economy, food problems of post-war Europe, and world population problems; correspondence; newsclippings; pamphlets; mementos; and other papers relating to Bennett's travels to Hawaii (1942), Japan (1947), and Africa.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Food Research Institute. Faculty.
controlaccess.subject: Food consumption.
World War, 1939-1945 --Food question.

did.unittitle: List of Merrill Bennett's published works
Various topics, including national standards of living, and domestic agricultural costs
One long work, "Analytical summaries of farming costs"
Various topics, including California agriculture and European wartime economy
Speeches concerning European wartime food economy
Various topics dealing with food problems of post-war Europe
Papers concerned with various aspects of international food economy
Various topics, including world population problems, and food supply
Mostly correspondence to Food Research Institute (not addressed by name) from Bennett's travels in East Africa
Materials concerned with food economy development in East Africa and foods of the New England Indians
American Indian and Hawaiian food economies
"Foods of the rainy tropics": notes, charts, maps and drafts
"Survival and losses of Aboriginal foods": notes, charts, maps and background materials
Bennett's notes on readings and a bibliography
"About Van Niel's book…": letters between Merrill Bennett and his son John Bennett, exchanging critical comments on the book
Hawaii in wartime: pamphlets, menus, magazine photos, and "list of rumours", kept by Bennett
Envelope containing notecards, "Names and notes on interviews"
Mementos, business cards from Japanese associates, itinerary, personnnel lists, ID card, correspondence and Air Raid Precautions Manual
Itinerary of Japan Trip, and passenger list of Canadian Pacific Cruise
Correspondence to Dorcas Bennett from Japan
Photographs of people: some family, most unidentified
Cousin Ben Brown and FRI friends
Domestic travel to Yosemite, Point Lobos, Golden Gate Park, some unidentified scenes
Notecard file containing bibliographic citations arranged by subject area
MKB to DGB (carbon of typed transcript)
MKB to DGB (carbon of typed transcript)
MKB to DGB (carbon of typed transcript)
Postcards to MKB/DGB from Steve, John and Polly
Mr. and Mrs. Steve Bennett to MKB/DGB
Mr. and Mrs. Steve Bennett to MKB/DGB
Mr. and Mrs. Steve Bennett to MKB/DGB
Family and home: photos and miscellaneous
Photographic portraits of Merrill K. Bennett
Wedding announcement, 1922, Christmas cards, photos of MKB and family

scopecontent.p: "2/3 Mankind Hungry too Pessimistic, Expert Says", Science service article, 1954 May 24; 2 boxes of slides: 257 total - family, 1953; domestic travel to california, Oregon, Colorado, and Texas (1951-52); Mexico; and African trip; Mementos from Japan; Postcard from Dorcas Bennett to son John, 1939 April 6; One large framed group Photograph (including Bennett) in the "House of Shining Waters", Japan; Two diplomas: M.A. Brown university, M.A. Harvard; Two testimonial scrolls: FRI retirement and recognition of service in the Governmental Food Agency; One unidentified photograph

Brown Commencement Week, 1920: booklet; Japan Tour, 1964: 2 photographs; Correspondence from Australia, 1964; Sachet of slides; MKB diary 1908; 3" reel of recording tape; Dorcas B. Gallup diaries 1916, 1917, 1918; Postcards from MKB to family, miscellaneous; Miscellaneous envelopes

Brown University Handbook, 1917-1918; Address book; Notebook; 2 world maps; "Aspects of the Pig"; Dedication of Food Research Institute, 1970 April 6: program and addresses; Miscellaneous letters to MKB and Clippings

did.unittitle: MKB and chilldren to Dorcas Bennett
Brown University diploma: L.H.D. (honorary) and commencement program
Certificates: birth, marriage, honorable discharge, identification papers
